website_summaries.verdict: For owners of two or more dogs, having a double set of training collars makes sense. All of the modes are effective, so actual shock can be a last resort.
pros: Beep mode is very loud and effective
Includes two collars for dual training
cons: Dual collars are difficult to coordinate
Battery life can be very short
Shock mode does not always work

customer_reviews.title: Returning product. Purchased dual receivers with remote transmitter but ...
customer_reviews.text: Returning product. Purchased dual receivers with remote transmitter but have issues with both collar receivers. One has the green light on all the time, which will drain the battery. Manual specified light should only be on when pushing the light button on the remote or when charging has completed. The second collar does not transmit the signals correctly. It is supposed to transmit for as long as you hold the button or time out automatically after 10 seconds. I’m worried with this fault, it either will not work when sending the signal or perhaps get stuck beeping/vibrating/shocking. I have emailed the company twice with no response before writing this review.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: I don't like these collars
customer_reviews.text: I don't like these collars. I put them on in the morning and a hour or so later I may let the dogs outside. Well our problem is barking so I will "vibrate them or shock them" as needed. But nothing happens. The collars are fully charged but it's like they go into sleep mode sometimes. And I need them to vibrate right away to take care of the problem not for me to have to call them in to check their collars.
customer_reviews.author: miranda henning

customer_reviews.title: Do not get these collars.
customer_reviews.text: These collars have been nothing but trouble for me. They constantly lose connection. I go to use it and nothing happens. I have to continually turn the collar back on because it shuts off. Extremely unreliable. The remote control is not laid out well. If you need to use it in a pinch you have to check and make sure it's on the right setting and then make sure it's on the right frequency for the collar you need to use. It is not made for quick reactions. I regret buying these so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof collar... but transmitter is very sensitive to moisture.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good training collar, we've been using it indoor and outdoors. However, we used the collar and transmitter outdoors one afternoon and the transmitter got damp (not wet but damp). Immediately after it got damp the LED screen lit up and basically none of the buttons would function. We tried putting it in rice to dry it out but it stay lit/non-functional until the battery eventually died and the transmitter has not functioned since. I'd like to give the product 4-5 stars but I'm very disappointed in the way the transmitter malfunctioned and never worked again.
customer_reviews.author: Danny E. Davis II

customer_reviews.title: let it charge like the booklet said
customer_reviews.text: I got this today, let it charge like the booklet said, and tried it out. My dog was making a weird face and I felt to see if it was shocking him and it was. The remote was sitting on the table so no one was pressing it. It was just shocking him on its own. Will be returning to get my money back. Not going to keep something that could be randomly shocking my doggies.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Instant Ritalin.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible device. I have a year old rescued Jack Russell mix. She would be totally unresponsive when she slipped out the door. She would take off across the road and to all the neighborhood houses. After ONE use of the collar on vibration mode, she instantly returned to me. Within the day (using only vibration) she became the perfect dog. When my daughter babysat her, she said that simply putting on the collar was “instant Ritalin.” She only activated it once when she tried to follow a salesman. She promptly returned. I tell everyone about it. One use in the car & she stopped barking at everyone. She is the happiest most well-behaved dog ever now. Great range too.
customer_reviews.author: A. SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work
customer_reviews.text: Only one collar worked (at first) which I guess wasn't a big deal as the one dog doesn't bark as much. While the worked it was great. The second the one dog heard the warning buzz she would stop barking. Never had to use the other settings. But then a week later the 2nd collar stopped working. So not worth the money. I'll go back to buying the cheap ones
customer_reviews.author: Nicolette Vargas

customer_reviews.title: effective training tool
customer_reviews.text: I would have thought it cruel to use a shock collar, until I learned that you don't really have to shock your dog more than once. That's what we did. We shocked her full strength the first time. Thereafter, we did not have to. We used the sound or the vibrate to give off a "warning" and she obeyed consistently. That's all it took - one time - and she learned. She is a 60lb Staffordshire Terrier, otherwise tough as nails. So, this is a good quality product and effective training tool. In the wrong hands, however, it could be a tool for cruelty, so, use wisely and beware of who you allow to operate the remote control.
customer_reviews.author: Monika C.

customer_reviews.title: Straightened my kids right up
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have a dog, but my kids were acting so awful, I bought these and told them that the shock collars would be the next step if they didn’t start behaving properly. Scared them so bad, they complied and I never had to even open up the box. A great deterrent for poorly behaved children, especially in an age where whippings are now frowned upon.
customer_reviews.author: fflando

customer_reviews.title: Leash Free Camping
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I camp a lot, it's much easier to train our dogs to stay near us or to answer our call than it is to keep them on a leash or a wire the entire time. Worked wonders on our 1 year old dachshund Ollie, he stays near us, listens, etc. Total night and day difference after training him on it for a few months. We rarely shock him, don't even vibrate that much, mostly use the beeper to get him to come back if he goes too far in the woods. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jared R. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Best. Training collar. EVER.
customer_reviews.text: I was so apprehensive about purchasing a shock collar as I’ve never advocated for or used one before, but I have a stubborn, tough, STRONG, pit/boxer and I was at my wit’s end. I’ve never even had to shock her. The alarm tone or at most, the vibration on a low setting has turned her into a whole new dog. The battery doesn’t last for as long as some others friends recommended/I looked into, but it comes with two collars so I just switch them out and charge the one I’m not using so I always have one ready. Alongside rigorous and consistent training, this collar has changed our lives. I’m not sure where we’d be without it!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made but Works
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made but you get what you pay for. I have no issues with this system other than after charging, sometimes I have to recalibrate them. I physically tested these on my hand, so I'd know what level I needed for my German Shepherds. I didn't get much of a shock until about the mid-60 range (even after fully charged). One of my dogs needs it at about 78 and the other at about 94-95 before they react to them. That's one thing that's good about these; the ability to fine-tune them. Ultimately, these do what they're supposed to, so I can't really complain. Good and effective for basic training but weak.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly R.

customer_reviews.title: Great ecollar for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: These collars are great for the money. Our dogs respond to the different settings and I love that it comes with multiple prongs for different fur lengths. I also love that they are waterproof. We have used them in the lake with no problems. Cons: If you leave the prong covers on the dogs do not respond to shock or vibrate at all. The collars will disconnect from the controller after sleep mode for an extended period (make sure you check every time or you will not be able to correct the behavior). Also, I do not like that you have to switch modes to control different dogs. It can make it very difficult when they are both misbehaving.
customer_reviews.author: Ocie

customer_reviews.title: Great training aid to teach our two dogs boundaries.
customer_reviews.text: We usually only use beeper tones or vibrate options. I have not had to use the ZAP mode but once and never have touched it again. This is especially great with our two Standard Poodles when we travel and they have the opportunity to run in a safe area. Peace of mind, control, use with respect for your dog and you'll have a valuable tool. When they are naughty all my husband or I have to do is hold up the transmitter and immediate response from the dogs! (Even when their collars are not on). I would NEVER use this with a child near, too easy to hurt/wreck a good, well-trained dog.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma LOVES to climb trees

customer_reviews.title: UGH!  1 Collar stopped working and I just purchased 2 weeks ago
customer_reviews.text: We use these collars in our yard and at campgrounds. Last night one of the girls ran off and I normally only have to use the "Beep" options and they come back. I used all features, and it wasn't working. GRRRR. Was on charge ALL NIGHT and will not turn on today! I cannot find a number to call for a replacement. I hate to do a full return, because i need at least one collar, but no other option. This is the second time I have ordered this exact set and usually one collar stops working. I will not order this brand again, quality and durability is highly lacking!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal vallieres

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life: Mom to sleeping newborn
customer_reviews.text: These collars arrived a few hours ago and have already changed my life. As the UPS man arrived my two dogs went nuts, effectively waking up the 3 month old I had just gotten to sleep. I opened them read the instructions and fit them on my two dogs (Hound and cavalier king Charles spaniel, very different sized dogs). Since then I have only had to discipline them using the remote (Vibrate only even) one time. Every other time someone has knocked in the past few hours since the first vibrate waa dealt they have been silent. THIS PRODUCT SAVED MY MOM TO A SLEEPING BABY SANITY. I will update it later to see how well it's lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I use the vibrating setting for when my dogs start barking too much, or try to be naughty. They now just need to be wearing the collar and are so well behaved took three days for them to get everything all down pat to my liking and they now do not bark or jump up on me. This was my last resort turning to this. I have two very stubborn German Shepard lab mix pups that I had tried everything from verbal, clickers, time outs etc. SO this was heaven sent when I found two collars for that price that both work and are sturdy. Have a stubborn pup? I highly recommend this for your fur baby.
customer_reviews.author: Kaweraklu

customer_reviews.title: Several inconvenient issues, wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it works ok but they put this warning label under the prongs so when you try to remove it the paper is stuck under the prongs. The prongs are on so tight they won't come off. Also the remote does not have a lanyard or even anywhere to hook your own which sucks because i like to wear it around my neck when we walk. Also the charger only lets you charge one receiver at a time, when you're using this for 2 dogs like I am it's a total bummer. Overall, I wouldn't recommend and I might return this product.
customer_reviews.author: kylea scott

customer_reviews.title: Best way to correct behavior!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. Charge lasts several days. You have to remember to turn it on if it sat over night (which it should because we don't leave it on the dog all the time). I had to fiddle around with the vibration and shock levels to get the dog to notice, but 60 (out of 100) seems effective. After that, progressing from beep, to vibrate, to shock got her attention and now a beep is all we need to correct behavior. We're using this to reduce barking, digging, chewing on our fruit trees, and harassing our rabbits. Because we can correct her behavior from inside the house, she is not associating us with the correction, perfect for training.
customer_reviews.author: Scott, DIY Mechanic

customer_reviews.title: Great training collar
customer_reviews.text: This is a great training device. We use it on our overly exuberant 4-year-old collie mix. I bought it because I liked that it had different settings, and also I like that it is not automatic but is rather controlled by the owner via remote control. We've never used the highest ("shock") setting, as the vibrate mode works perfectly to help control our pup's behavior when he starts to get out of control or wild. The vibration is just enough to disrupt and end bad behavior while being gentle (it feels like a phone vibration). I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: I responded to the sellers questions and they replied stating they would send me a replacement. As of today, it hasn't happened.
customer_reviews.text: After only a couple of weeks, the collar stopped responding to the remote. And one function on the remote has also stopped functioning. However, I did contact the seller and they responded with questions. Once I hear from them what they plan to do, I will update this review. When it worked, it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: READ BEFORE USING
customer_reviews.text: Preliminary review, will update after using for awhile: the shock and vibrate settings go from 1-99. That means that you (the handler) MUST put that sucker on your bare skin and test the pain level. My boys (3 and 5 year old pit mixes) won’t even feel that until we get to a 15-17. If you have a much younger or much smaller dog, you may start them lower. You should ALWAYS test the stimulus on yourself first (prevents you from abusing the tool), but it is especially important with this particular collar. Other than that, four stars at this point. Seems to be well made, holds a charge, multiple posts.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I use these collars in the car. My dogs bark like crazy in the car. With these collars I set the tone when I put them on so the boys know they are working. They get a warning buzz and if they continue the bad behavior they get a zap. I literally now just put them on set the tone and the boys are settled and quite the entire trip. They are pretty smart so after the second trip in the car with the collars they knew the score. As a side note, my husband won't use the collars in his car and so the boys bark insanely when they ride with him. It is all about the collars!
customer_reviews.author: mylois

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I've been controlling two dogs with one controller. Have had these for over a month and they work great and seem durable. They hold a charge well, only need to charge about once a week this time of year (winter). I love the easy-access charging port on the collars. This is a great advantage compared to other brands, where the port is located underneath the collar strap. UPDATE: I've now been using these for quite a while and have dropped the controller MANY times - and it has held up well. I thought this bit of information would be good to share.
customer_reviews.author: Diane R

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly for training!
customer_reviews.text: OUTSTANDING COLLARS! I LOVE this set up. It is so useful and my great danes behave beautifully - Pain free direction that gets immediate results? What more can you ask for? I never have to use the Shock. The Vibrate and Sound are all I ever need to get my gentle giants to stop barking at the Television (UGH I Hate that!), Stop playing rough with my grandson, stay away from something... Truly this has saved us all a lot of aggravation and stress. I highly recommend this set. At first it may seem complicated, but after looking over the directions you will be a pro in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: georgia-sunflower

customer_reviews.title: Buy this instead of expensive perimeter fence
customer_reviews.text: Works FANTASTIC ! Was way better than spending 2100.00 on a perimeter fence .Dogs trained in 2 days plus can use collar on any place taking dogs to be well behaved. Recommend over any perimeter fence which I know plenty of people have and don't even use or work anymore. Placed flags around perimeter and yellow marking tape to teach dogs. Took down after 1 week and dogs learned not to go beyond. Highly Recommend ! Spending 50.00 total instead of 2100.00 a NO BRAINER !
customer_reviews.author: charles coveleski

customer_reviews.title: Coonhounds, need I say more?
customer_reviews.text: Been using these daily for several years now and they work great. For one dog I never have to push a button he knows it's on him, the other dog just beep and vibrate and he comes in. Before purchasing I would sometimes spend a half hour chasing my Treeing Walker Coonhounds around trying to get them inside and by then they were covered in mud. I bet my neighbors laughed. Tip: Pick a day each week to charge them and they never go dead, I chose Saturday. Lost one in the snow and found it the next spring, the battery still worked. Not sure about the range but perfect for the backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good Customer Service...
customer_reviews.text: I used this on two medium size dogs since October 2018. I think this is a good product for animals who don't play. My dogs like to play a lot and the devices simply fell apart after a few months. They carry a one year warranty, I was able to use it twice, one for a non-functional remote and one for a non functional unit. After much consideration I think that if you have playful animals, it is best to go to get them into obedience school. The product works, but it likely won't last past it's warranty period
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: required high vibration settings, battery life good, collars cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: these collars did a great job. Required super high vibrating settings to get dogs' attn. The collars are basically plastic and not durable at all... when they tore up I found it basically impossible to find any collar that would fit through the slots....itried sewing them into collars, using velcro and even tape but ALL my efforts failed bc the collars would did under, to side or dig into their necks with 1 prong....
customer_reviews.author: Am_Still_Standin

customer_reviews.title: I'm actually really happy with this I was worried when I bought it ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually really happy with this I was worried when I bought it that my dog would freak out. I just use it for when I have company over and if we are off leash in a field or trail I really only use the vibration function but if I absolutely have to I like the fact that it's not an electric shock collar it's more like and annoying static shock. I like the fact that every component of it is waterproof except for perhaps a charger I wasn't going to test about but I accidently don't the remote control and haven't had a problem with it once it dried out completely.
customer_reviews.author: ashe

customer_reviews.title: Stupid Sleep Mode
customer_reviews.text: Stupid sleep mode. When it goes into sleep mode at least 1/2 the time it doesn’t come back out of it. I use this collar for when we are all outside as a family, when my dog sees a cat she will chase it and not come back. So if it goes into sleep mode I’m screwed. I never know if it’s going to be working. I’ll never buy one with sleep mode again.
customer_reviews.author: Long123

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This arrived fast and did what I needed it to do. I would never shock my dogs, however I needed something to deter them from digging under fence and trying to get out when they saw something that excited them. One dog all that was needed was beeps and he went running the other direction. The other dog I had to use vibrations, he's a Pyrador so he has thick hair and I had to turn it all the way up but once I found the right setting it worked great, after a couple weeks no longer needed to use it. The battery life is good, it lasts a while in sleep mode. Range is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Battery does not last that long but good product. I got both my dogs one of these when they where in training and I only had to shock them one time and now whenever I press the button to make the beep noise they listen great. I have no fence and this keeps my dogs in my yard. Does sound pretty mean to do the "shock collar" but if you need it as in my case with no fence it really helps. My boyfriend shocked himself as so did I before we put it on our dogs and it is not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Cortney Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, waterproof, affordable and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional dog trainer and have used e collars for many years. This one is the BEST one on amazon, hands down! Comes with a convenient wall charger that both collar and remote can plug into simultaneously. Remote is extremely simple and easy to use. Also comes with different sized prongs, to fit your dog accordingly. I've recommended this particular set to family, friends and clients and they have all been thoroughly pleased. Great quality, waterproof, super affordable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Only one collar works-does not switch between one and two.
customer_reviews.text: We bought the one with two collars-you’re supposed to be able to switch between collar one and two, that doesn’t work. It only works on collar one,collar two never goes off when prompted so basically I paid for two to have one single collar work. The collar itself is amazing and works wonders, but I have TWO dogs, so now I have to switch this collar on and off of each and train them completely separately because I only have one that works out of the package of two. Makes training much more frustrating. (It came fresh out of the box not working-never responded once) would like to send one back for a partial refund.
customer_reviews.author: BG-Key

customer_reviews.title: Use it on yourself first
customer_reviews.text: If used as a proper training device it works great. This is my second set. I’m telling you, try it on yourself first. So you know what you will be doing to your dog. If you can’t handle it, don’t do it to them. I’ve used these on 3 dogs, and never had to go above “10”. The audible function is all I really use. Vibrate works good too. The light function really has no purpose in my situation.
customer_reviews.author: John Prass

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this purchase. Purchased Sep 2016 and by Christmas 2016 the collars barely hold a charge and by Spring 17 neither hold a charge or work. I am now on here searching for another device to replace in less than a year. Our use of these collars and purpose was to deter barking, and it did that beautifully during the time in which they worked. Our use of them was on the VERY low side. We used them steadily at time of purchase and for about a month - then only as needed for the behavior modification. So it is disheartening that they with such little use are worthless now. :-(
customer_reviews.author: witchy_gurl

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable Great Company
customer_reviews.text: My dog collar arrived defective and remote would not pair with collars, so I returned it to Amazon and did not leave a 5 star review. Petrainer offered to replace, but I declined, since after receiving defective collars, I installed an electric fence. This wonderful company offered to send me the collars without payment because they want satisfied customers, which I do not expect them to do. I don't expect any product free, but I am thrilled with a company who wants to make a mistake "right" at their expense.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: These collars are very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: These collars are very good for the price. I have two young cocker spaniels that are impossible to walk as they run at any car that goes slightly above the speed limit and we don’t have a side walk outside our house. No amount of training would stop it. I used the vibrate function on this once and they now no longer do it when they are wearing them. The battery lasts weeks (although I am not using the functions much as just having the collars on stops them acting up) and they are sturdy. I would recommend these collars. If only the dogs would walk well without the collars on!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: not for serious training
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use while my 5-year old Dogtra is being serviced. I knew it was not a quality product by price alone. The hesitation is horrible and one collar needs to be recharged every day with very little use. I find that the collars need to be synced almost daily. It is not user friendly when using as a two dog system. I have found that it does not have nearly the range advertised even with no obstructions. If you are serious this is not the collar to use. For my application not having a collar is better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST one I've tried, and I've tried many
customer_reviews.text: This is the best electronic collar I have used. I have searched for many and this one is above all I have tried. The things that set it apart are: The plastic is heavy duty, the pairing is easy and it wakes up from sleep mode with the press of any button. The last one is the most important when trying to train, because you want to grab the behavior right away. If you have to press the mode button, verify it is in the desired setting and then correct - it's too late. With this one, it keeps the last setting and activates right away with the press if the 'Y' button even from a deep sleep.
customer_reviews.author: David Limer

customer_reviews.title: I want to know if this will be replaced!
customer_reviews.text: The remote for this collar is not very good. First the adjustment for the "sound volume" quit working, which I could live with. Now the entire remote does not interact with the collar! I always charge in between uses. the collar and remote charge, but no not interact. VERY DISAPPOINTED PLEASE REPLACE THIS AT NO CHARGE.
customer_reviews.author: Help Support Our Children's Education!

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool my first training collar definitely not my last.
customer_reviews.text: Never was for shock collars. I've had lots of dogs and train them all good. I'm in a wheelchair now and I can't get the puppies quick as I used to. These collars are my hand wherever the puppy is. I like them adorable I would buy again and I definitely recommend for training. I also put one on my hundred and ten pound American Bulldog because he barks a lot. I don't barely ever use shock I use tone and vibrate work. If your dog isn't listening to the tone and vibrate give it a shock a couple times of that in your dog will obey to just the vibrate or beep
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1X charge - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: After 1x charging it and using, I attempted to charge the units and the light won't blink and the unit won't turn on.....seem to be completely fried??? After only 1 charging, this is NOT ok! Not to mention, it was while I had my dogs off leash (using these units) that I noticed they were not working.....could have been very unsafe! Good thing I noticed before my dogs roamed off! I've attempted contact with the company since the item came with warranty...I have not heard anything as to wether or not they will stand behind their product / warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny

customer_reviews.title: This seems to work well. My dogs are smaller ...
customer_reviews.text: This seems to work well. My dogs are smaller so it only takes a small amount to get their attention. I do not have to use the static shock. I use the vibration. I find the smallest dog needs very little to get his attention. The bigger one needs a bit more to get her attention, I think mostly because she has a lot more hair and she is more stubborn. But after getting her attention she does not need reminding. The collar is a bit bulky for my smaller dog, but it works very well. Takes longer with him because he is a barker, but we are working on it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Price

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but there are better options.
customer_reviews.text: These are great when they work. Life expectancy of a battery charge is about 3 days or so. I only used the one receiver for a while because I oknot had one dog. We recently got another dog and have started using the other. Sadly the remote seems to think it's controlling both at the same time so it's correcting both dogs. My poor well behaved one is getting so confused. I've had to stop and look for other options. My puppy is a pitt, well behaved, but hyper and pulls on a leash. We're working on getting him to focus better. This worked wonderfully with my Husky, but they're only good for short term. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: MNonya

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have to add that the set I originally bought were not keeping a charge more than 1-2 days. I called the company, asked them if the battery was replaceable, was informed that it wasn't and that the receivers should stay charged longer than what I was experiencing. He said he would send me a new set, I told him the order # and got the new set in a few days. They are working very well. Very happy with the product and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I have four large dogs and use these types of collars as training devices. We have a ranch, and we have one dog that has a bit of a prey drive. I only ever used the shock feature once (not very high), but she no longer chases chickens. She may need a beep or vibration reminder, but her recall is excellent and she minds me so much better. At one time I had the school of thought that shock collars were cruel, but when used correctly, they are a fantastic tool to help redirect a stubborn dog.
customer_reviews.author: Physhyr

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have two pit bulls. One is stubborn and the other is the perfect dog. I use the training collars on both Blu and Bino. With Bino, I only have to use the beeping sound to indicate his misbehavior. For Blu, I use the vibrate feature. I like the vibrate feature because it keeps me from using the shock feature. I only had to shock Blu once for his misbehavior and he quickly changed his tune. Great product. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Update: avoid
customer_reviews.text: Update 10/15/19: it doesn't work at all anymore. Also a pain to have to switch between dogs with one controller- esp if they're both barking. About 2 years in and the controller works about 30% of the time. Have to press the button about 6 times and it *may* work. Disappointed. Other than that, I guess you could say it works. My dog is stubborn. It stopped him from barking in the moment but he doesn't learn and starts up again. My other dog responded better.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 small dogs that want to run next door and play with the puppies. These trainers have helped to keep them home instead of running over there. We live in the country and have some acreage that gets planted every year and we were worried they would get out of sight. These trainers have helped with that too. We like these trainers for our small dogs. Just powerful enough to get the message across to these 2 stubborn little dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Too bIg for Chihuahuas
customer_reviews.text: I bought this collar to help train my dog. I have a chihuahua and I have been trying to find something to assist with training and reinforcement. The actual product is a five star if you have size appropriate dogs. However for my chihuahua it looked ridiculously big where he had trouble even moving his head with it on. If you have anything other than a chihuahua I would recommend. Anything chihuahua size this collar is too big.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Nunez-Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Loosing pairing often
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this at first. Has every function I want, the clicker is small yet works with both collars. I love that each piece is rechargeable.... Now for the one star. I've only had it a few months and about a month in it decided it was going to have problems pairing with each collar. I have made sure everything is fully charged and even tried repairing them. It acts like it pairs, but anytime I send a command from the clicker to the collars, nothing happens. If I was still in the return window I would return it. Alas, I'm out the money and now need to go find a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina  O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Good product reasonably priced and well made I like the ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product reasonably priced and well made I like the fact that collars can be cut to size and can fit almost any size dog. Within a day or two all I need to do is put the collar on and the change in my bulldog puppy is dramatic. He instantly calm and very obiediant. It is especially useful with his interaction with my little Shorkie although he just wants to play he's 50 lbs and she's probably 3 so we were concerned for her safety. Now he knows he can socialize but can not rough house with her. Thank you for a great product
customer_reviews.author: michelle & John

customer_reviews.title: Super impressed... great results, great price!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if we just have the smartest puppies in the world but 1 try with this collar cured our problems. We had just trained them on a invisible pet fence so the transfer to this collar may have been a bit easier. We were having problems walking our puppies near a canal, we couldn't keep them out of it. We bought the two collars and after a bit of a learning curve on how to work them....Wow! Success! I have only used the shock mode once. I do use the buzz mode more often, not that I really need to. Great results for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: sweet

customer_reviews.title: Excellent training tool
customer_reviews.text: These collars work great. They can be easily cut to fit any size dog. I have dogs from 3.8 pounds up to 75 pounds and the collars fit any of them. To make them easier to put on and take off, I cut the collar to the size needed for the small dogs and replaced the buckle with Velcro. The small dogs usually respond to the beep, while the pit bull generally needs the shock setting. All my dogs respond well to the collars, and though they still wear them when out for walks, they rarely have to be used now as they listen to my voice immediately.
customer_reviews.author: w.silver

customer_reviews.title: Quality and effectiveness 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this training collar! I have experience with others and this is my favorite. I haven't tried it in water yet. My 75lb boxer responded to the vibration a few times, I now have to use the shock but he has learned fast enough that on lease vibration and sound work well. Off leash he needs the shock but responds quickly. It's like a very strong tens unit. The clip on transmitter isn't very secure so when you bend over to pick up poo it will slip off where ever you have it clipped, but hasn't broken (I dont put in it my pocket to avoid accidental sending). Other than that I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kwizzle

customer_reviews.title: Worked great the first six months.
customer_reviews.text: Edited: Though we started having issues after 6 months we contacted the seller just short of one year because the remote stopped holding a charge. Without question they sent us out a new one. Very impressed with their customer service! At first I really liked these collars. We have an 80lb boxer puppy and this really helped with training. But six months later the vibration is no longer working. This is the most used signal we use as it did a better job at getting his attention.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie Leachman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. A couple things I don’t like is the battery life isn’t all that great and for some reason, they literally just turn off and disconnect every now and then. Not every day, just occasionally. Also, I wish they made different fabrics for the collars along with shorter ones because I have two pits, and even though they have thick necks, both of the collars have an extremely long tail once tightened. And cutting it looks stupid, but oh well. Overall, pretty good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Bought the two receiver package. One receiver started acting up. Emailed the company and they promptly emailed back asking what it was doing. I explained it to them and within 24 hours they emailed me that another was on the way, no need to return the defective merchandise. I think that is stellar customer service. Overall the collar is phenomenal for the price. I think the one receiver was just defective to start which is common with any electronic when mass produced. I have a stubborn dog and it works well. Stays charged a long time and fits my big dog and medium sized dog comfortably with an adjustable collar with many size variations. Great company!
customer_reviews.author: thastings46

customer_reviews.title: I like to vibration feature
customer_reviews.text: Works reasonably well, I like to vibration feature. Remote buttons tend to be a little challenging to work, glad my older dogs seldom need correction. I don't even use the shock feature, after reading comments about some other similar training collars that malfunctioned and inadverdently zapped dogs, I removed the contacts and taped over the holes. If you're looking for a collar to train a new dog and will use the shock feature, consider spending more on a higher quality collar. After years of being used to the training collar, my dogs will respond to my merely reaching for the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Zyzzogeton

customer_reviews.title: Great collar
customer_reviews.text: Update: the black collar has stopped working which is a shame because I really liked these and have told people I’ve met in the dog park. With two dogs it’s not a good outcome only having since January. I’ve waited a few weeks before writing this review. These dog collars work great! I have two 90 lb dogs that I now let off leash in the woods to run. All I do is vibrate it for them to come back or if they see another dog. I haven’t used the shock feature as the vibrate works fine with them. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: momof2

customer_reviews.title: Decent price
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth set I've purchased, first of this kind. So far the best comparable to an expensive hunting brand. Lots of level choices. Shock very strong, husband tested first, immediately said we'd NOT be using the higher settings on the dogs. Nice level settings for vibrations. *****later date edit, had to send back, thankfully within the alloted time frame. One collar completely stopped working and the other wouldn't hold a charge. So disappointed, refund and return went smooth though.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The collar worked great when it worked
customer_reviews.text: When the collars and remote were first charged, only one collar would respond to programming. I could not get the other collar to respond. All functions worked on the first collar. Now, the collar that responded, only makes the sound function, will not vibrate at all. I made sure all was fully charged before attempting any programming ect. The collar worked great when it worked, and my dog was very responsive. I am very disappointed that the product no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price!!
customer_reviews.text: Just started using this for our 8 month old Australian Shepard mix to correct the bad behavior of eating rocks. Every time we said drop it, she would swallow the rock. Very scary! Now with the collar, when we see her with a rock in her mouth, we don't say anything to her and use the vibration mode at 70 - she drops the rock right away and comes to us. Hopefully over time, she will stop this behavior altogether. So far it's getting less and less - thank god! Love this product so far!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: 2 Collars 1 Remote...Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased about a month ago. Nice to have one remote for two separate collars. The vibration is more startling than the "static-shock" though. You can adjust the intensity of the shock and vibration too. I haven't been using the shock, because the vibration and beep work really good. Charge, so far, holds for about a week. I only use the collars while letting my dogs outside to go potty or just getting fresh air, not outside for more than a couple of hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: But their customer service is wonderful. They kept sending trouble shooting ideas to assist
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble with the first set of collars, they wouldn't work. But their customer service is wonderful. They kept sending trouble shooting ideas to assist. When that didn't work, they sent me a free replacement. They care about lot about their customers' satisfaction. It says a lot when a business cares. Now my 3 dogs are being trained to behave better- staying in the yard, controlling their barking, and not chewing my kids' toys. There are multiple levels to correct bad behavior. You start with the lowest recommended level and increase as needed. Very happy with the product and their customer service is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Reindeer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product for money.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my collars for about a week now. My only problem is both collars work when set to number 2 but when the collars are set to number 1 on the remote they don’t work. I’ve tried both collars as number 1 with no sound/vibrate/shock. I’ve tried both collars as number 2 with sound/vibrate/shock all working. When the collars are working I see a complete change in attitude with my dogs. Our biggest problem is jumping on people and jumping on counters. With the collar I can easily correct the behavior while I’m busy doing other things. Disappointed mine didn’t work properly, but would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working. :(
customer_reviews.text: I used these collars daily. It was a life saver. It changed my dogs behavior when we went on walks. It literally was the best. We actually made a stand for the collars to charge them up every night. THEN out of no where, they STOPPED working. One went out first, so we were down to one, and then BAM the other stopped working. I literally felt so sad when I had to throw them away.
customer_reviews.author: Eden

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle!
customer_reviews.text: I’m really glad that I’ve saved my money and went with this. Easy to use and handle. Vibrations works really well I haven’t needed to shock my dogs. Because with the vibration it already triggers them and stops them from barking. The settings are from 1-100 for both vibrations and shocking. It has a little light mode on your remote. Overall I found it so easy to use and quick to learn. Which is nice. The collars come very long so you can size it up to any dog breed and when you get it at the length needed for your dog, you can easy just cut it off. Or leave it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Wong

customer_reviews.title: Works for what it’s worth
customer_reviews.text: Not the best, but by far not the worst behavioral collar. We like the multiple settings and not having to shock our dog, but like so many people mentioned we constantly accidentally beep, vibrate, or shock our dog. We keep the settings low to prevent it from getting out of hand, but the function of the remote isn’t the best. I do like how waterproof it is (our doodle LOVES swimming) and the range.
customer_reviews.author: Amesue

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Especially
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Works great! Especially, for raising German Shepard puppies on the farm (sadly, they killed a few chickens and some ducklings prior to using these collars.) Pups have only needed the shock option a few times. The beeping option is used frequently, then the vibration if no quick response to the beep. They immediately stop what they are doing and run right to us. Great training tool and prevention/end of farm animal deaths (it comes down to the dogs going or loosing poultry, etc. These collars saved the puppies. ) Cons: Only one charger comes for both collars which is inconvenient, since our pups wear these 24/7. Therefore, only one collar can charge at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I have an Airedale and GSD. One peep from outside will set one off and the other will start in with barking. It was happening 5 times a day minimum. I bought these collars and had to use them only a few times. Now, if I just simply put them on, they will usually settle down and cease barking. If not, a warning beep will do the trick. I have only used the vibration, never had to use the shock feature. I thought one collar was defective but reading through the instruction manual, I just needed to sync the collar with the remote. Life is way more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee Webster

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Works good for what we need. My only complaint is that it's not easy to switch from dog to dog with the setting buttons. You have to make sure you know what setting it was left on because it's easy to accidently shock when you were trying to find another setting or mode. Has held up after months of use. Training wise it has been helpful just not as effective for one of our dogs because the prongs are too short for her thicker coat and skin, even with the adjustable ones. If needed I would buy again to help aid in training.
customer_reviews.author: James Kipfer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value and seems to work well. I don't care for the plastic collars but I just put my own on. The plastic collar it the only reason for giving 4 star instead of 5. I really don't like tongue buckles, I much prefer a side release buckle. I can't confirm the range capability because my yard is not that big. The battery lasts for quite a while before you have to charge it. Very useful training device when used properly. I have purchased much more expensive products that did not work as well or as reliably as this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: This is a great item to have for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews--however we have two dogs (Australian shepherd 60+ pounds & maltese 11 pounds) they both have starting barking a lot. We haven't actually used this collar on shock mode however we have used it on vibrating mode and it works great!!! We know just have to show them the collar and they stop!! It's very durable and comfortable for them both! I would definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: katie sargent

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this for the price especially. Today was the first day I used with my two dogs(who are 5 years old and 5 months old) it is pretty self explanatory except I wish it was a bit more obvious which collar was receiving at the moment, the numbers are pretty small. I also wish there was a dual function to be able to discipline both at once and not just one collar for when they’re being rambunctious and both need correcting when verbal orders don’t work but overall I am happy with this
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and effective
customer_reviews.text: The collars do great job. We have a black lab who does not listen well. One beep and he corrects his behavior with a verbal command. We have not used the shock feature only beep a d vibrate. Our other mutt is a barker, when we beep her collar she corrects her behavior with a verbal command as well. I do wish the charger had a way to charge both collars at the same time. The battery life is really good and we have only needed to charge both collars at once one time.
customer_reviews.author: Tom P.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, don’t believe the bad reviews on switching channels!! UPDATE IN REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: Before buying these I read a lot of reviews saying it was hard to switch between channels. I have two 50+ lbs dogs and believe me switching channels is not a issue so don’t keep that from buying. THEY WORK GREAT!! We have changed behaviors and have only used the vibrate, never have used shock! UPDATE 7/31/19 after almost a year of use the plastic power button on both collars pushed through and could possibly let water in. I contacted the manufacturer and a replacement is on its way after confirming my Amazon order number. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!
customer_reviews.author: BigMikey619

customer_reviews.title: Jump on in
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended for lots of reasons. Dogs swim every day with collars. No issues. I control the intensity and kind of protection. Buzzer works most of the time, unless they are extremely distracted (smaller dogs beat up on Lab when the Lab goes in the pool, which is a big problem, now solved). Highly recommended for quality, ease of use, and, offering the right kind of correction when needed. Shock isn't always the best option. When it is, it can be dialed way down (10 works just fine). I love this product. Wasted lots of money on others. This is the best. Thanks to Amazon reviews for once again getting it right. I will pile on.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon

customer_reviews.title: the battery charges don't last terribly long and the remote feels fragile
customer_reviews.text: the battery charges don't last terribly long and the remote feels fragile, but this system works as advertised. probably the best option out there for the price. one note - watch the stickers on the collar receivers. if they peel off then the collar units are no longer water resistant. one of my dogs is a bit wild when playing outside, and she ended up peeling one of the stickers off at some point, requiring a DIY repair to ensure water resistance. also, i wouldn't trust this as the main collar used for lead / leash attachment. the strap seems strong enough, but the buckle mechanism isn't the strongest.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Black

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a game changer for us. I never thought I'd be able to take my girl outside without a leash....until now. I've had the collar for a little over a month, and it's now to the point that just putting the collar on her is all that's needed. No beeper, no vibrate, no shock. I've never even had to shock her. The vibrate function was enough to get her attention. I believe I have that set at 40. (My girl is an 80 lb. border collie/lab mix.) Now she can enjoy romping around in the woods, without getting yanked by the leash because I'm not as crazy as she is! :) Love this collar!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Williams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for our 2 huskies. We use vibrate function only but can use the beep function to ensure the battery is charged and on. Worked really well for about 7 months before the one receiver vibrated our one dog non stop for a minute before we realized what was going on. We immediately removed the receivers from both dogs and contacted customer service. They are sending a replacement receiver and remote. Excellent value for a 2 dog e collar system. Wish it had continued to work as flawlessly, but am pleased with the extremely responsive customer service and their willingness to replace the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Ulsh

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, I have two bird dogs very rarely do they get further than 100 yards away. Charges quickly and holds charge all day in the field. I usually only use a tone and not the shock, but starting on each hunt you usually have to nick a dog and then stay with the tone. The collars are waterproof because both dogs are in the water, collars are durable and so is the controller. I use the collars every weekend and have not had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: DBS

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product twice within the same year. I realized that they just aren't as sturdy as a more expensive one. Finally opted for a system that was a little more expensive and completely happy with that one. This one says its water proof but I have two big dogs that like to play and tear at each other. These collars did not stand up to their boy antics (heavy wrestling). I would recommend spending a little more money and getting the tougher ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but
customer_reviews.text: I have litter mate puggle brothers. One has shorter hair than the other. Sometimes the vibrate and shock don't work on the longer hair puggle whereas his short haired brother gets the correction. I thought I was doing something wrong or it was off but nope, no matter how high I turn it up, he is completely unphased :( Which sucks. Otherwise, I'll make sure it's very snug before I let them out and hope for the best. It's working wonderful for the other baby though.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Best correction collar at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I have used these collars over the past 5 years to correct the behavior of my 3 dogs. One dog wants to rush up to other dogs, one wants to chase wild animals and the third pulss on leah and refuses to drop his tennis ball. I can usually correct these behaviors using the beep mode, sometimes must use the vibrate mode and rarely use the shock mode which really gets their attention but causes them no harm. As a 62 year old these collars have enabled me to walk and control my 3 large Labs every day both on lease and off.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Maleport

customer_reviews.title: These are best for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through about 3 sets of these over the years and I have tried several others. They work as advertised, don't go off by mistake and the remote is ok (just ok) to use (too complicated for some). The battery does need charging more and more after several months of usage (less than a year) but all in all there's not another remote trainer I would buy in this price range. I would always choose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bohemiac

customer_reviews.title: They work pretty good for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I got these for hunting with my 2 Brittney's. They work great and are tough for dogs in the field. My only complaint is that when you use this for 2 dogs its hard to tell what dog you are buzzing because of the way the controller switches from dog 1 and dog 2. It holds a nice charge in both controller and collars. I got one collar that didn't work customer service got me a new one very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Norton

customer_reviews.title: Works great for traveling and the stubborn dog that tests the invisible fence.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd purchase of this. They work great and if you’re dog is already trained on a invisible fence. I have used this for when we are traveling and also when my dog starts testing our invisible fencing. I take the remote with me and track him down and just give him the beep and he comes to my car. He knows that’s the warning sound. I am totally thrilled with this and it’s made my life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: NATALIE

customer_reviews.title: Works AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: These collars are amazing. The price is great for someone like me who is a broke college student with two mischievous German Shepherds. They are definitely waterproof as we live right by a creek and the dogs have taken a swim a few times now. The charge lasts for a while on collars and the remote. The settings go from 1 to 100 on the vibrate and shock but you only need 50 max for most dogs. My dogs need about 70 when chasing after other animals but it has shown improvement already. My females recall is already improving and my puppy is coming and sitting so much better. I would definitely recommend these collars.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Mazur

customer_reviews.title: Been using this ecollar for a year and we love it.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been using this E-Collar for about a year now and we love it. The costumer service is also awesome! Our charger malfunctioned last week and I didn't want to have to purchase a whole new set so I emailed them to ask where I could purchase just the charger. I received an email the next morning saying they sent me a replacement. I thought that was really cool considering I was totally willing to buy a new charger from them... I'm very satisfied with both the product and the service.
customer_reviews.author: ItsSaturday

customer_reviews.title: Hunters look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to start training my GSP for hunting and manor training. One collar did not work out of the box, and the other one does not shock. Luckily my GSP is effected enough by the buzz or beep that I don't need a shock. In the field this is spotty at best. Used it 3x and if the dog is more than about 10 yards away, it sometimes works. Not sure if that has to do with the heavy brush in between the dog/me or what. This product did help me train my dog, but both my dad/brother have GSPs and purchased more expensive shock collars that work a lot better and are 3-5 years old now.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah M.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely great for the price and I would recommend other people ...
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly! My dogs are no longer running away and barking at everything and everyone. I was a bit afraid and skeptic, but I don't let my dogs sleep with the collars and they usually wear them for a couple of hours. Inside the house I only set it to vibration and outside I've set it to shock because they have tried to runaway and thankfully now they don't runaway anymore. For shocking I have it set to 30 for the female and 35 for the male dog, my dogs are small/ medium. Definitely great for the price and I would recommend other people to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Damaris Nevarez

customer_reviews.title: 3 functions.
customer_reviews.text: Like that there is two of them, I have a brother and sister German Shephard, they get each other going sometimes and it helps when I can use the vibration to tell one or the other to stop, rather then trying to yell and them both. Now I don’t even have to put the collars on, I just turn one on and beep it and the dogs stop.
customer_reviews.author: Desirae VanDeWalker

customer_reviews.title: Good product for price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great product. I like that it also has a sound button besides vibrate and shock. It is not as easy to use as my last one. Having to change between modes is confusing. I would definitely feel better about having separate buttons for the shock setting. But I understand to keep the price low it might not be possible .
customer_reviews.author: Sabine

customer_reviews.title: Works great and affortable.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for a collar that wore out but had worked very well with my border collie. We recently had a stray come into our lives and needed a collar for him as well This was a very affordable replacement and it works well for walking two high energy dogs off leash. I don't actually shock them as they respond to just the beep. It is easy to toggle back and forth between the two different collars and although I haven't used them there are lots of different settings for the shock and vibration stimuli. Customer service was also great. I had an issue with one of the collars shutting off and they replaced it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Amy k

customer_reviews.title: Really corrects bad behavior.
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why I didn't purchase this year's ago. My dogs clawed at doors, opened doors, barked etc. I have only had these collars for a week and their behavior has improved greatly only having to use the beep. Sometimes I can just show them the remote and they stop their bad behavior. A real life and door saver. I would definitely purchase these again and recommend them. It does take a little while to get use to using the remote and having to reset the collar. I did contact customer service when I first got them and they walked me through my problem. Nice to be able to reach a real person.
customer_reviews.author: michael maciejewski

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: I keep a collar on my grumpy dog and have only used the buzzer option on him. Just wearing it keeps him from thinking bad thoughts about our other male. I use the other collar on a bitch that we have who is trying to work her way up the hierarchy. I have also used the collar for recall training. Works great, easy to use and lasts a long time. This is the third set that I have.
customer_reviews.author: CAFA

customer_reviews.title: Can only charge 1 collar unit at a time
customer_reviews.text: System works great. Charge is really good. I have been able to get two full, intermittently of course, days using VIBRATE AND SPEAKER. The one problem that I have is that you can only recharge one collar at a time. This presents a problem if you are in consistent training with two dogs at the same time. Not a big deal but does sometimes make it a little cumbersome. If it were not for this little problem I would give it 10 stars if it were available.
customer_reviews.author: Roadrunner

product_meta.title: Petrainer Shock Collar for Dogs - Waterproof Rechargeable Dog Training E-Collar with 3 Safe Correction Remote Training Modes, Shock, Vibration, Beep for Dogs Small, Medium, Large
feature_bullets: 3 Training Modes : Bark collar with remote for static stimulation & vibration and standard tone mode
Put an End to Bad Behaviors : Can be used to correct barking, leash training & behavioral obedience
Waterproof Receiver : Rechargeable, waterproof dog e collar receiver & transmitter can be charged
Remote Range : Remote dog training collar is designed with RF434Mhz technology range up to 330 yards
